meanings.definition: To blur or distort an image by dividing it into pixels.
meanings.sent1: I will pixelate the photo to make it look fuzzy.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pixelate the picture for privacy reasons.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally pixelated the painting, creating a unique masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day seemed to pixelate in his mind, becoming fragmented.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight through the window seemed to pixelate the room, casting a mosaic of light and shadow.

meanings.definition: To convert an image into pixels.
meanings.sent1: He used a software to pixelate the logo for the website.
meanings.sent2: The camera automatically pixelates the image for online sharing.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could pixelate a photo into a magic spell.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to pixelate into a digital format, making them easier to process.
meanings.sent5: The rain on the window seemed to pixelate the view outside, distorting the colors into tiny squares.

meanings.definition: To create a pixelated effect in an image.
meanings.sent1: The graphic designer will pixelate the background to add a retro look.
meanings.sent2: They decided to pixelate the text to give it a digital feel.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he would pixelate the dessert to make it look like a computer screen.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night seemed to pixelate into a beautiful mosaic of colors.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks in the sky appeared to pixelate into a mesmerizing display of light and color.
